## Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

### Procurement Overview

**Vendor Name:** David Peter
**Title:** Elder Services
**Procurement ID:** PW-22-01005454

**Services Overview**

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking to engage the services of an Elder to provide spiritual and cultural support to Indigenous offenders. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing counseling, teachings, and ceremonial services to offenders, as well as advising staff on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide spiritual and cultural support to Indigenous offenders
* Conduct ceremonies and provide teachings on Indigenous spirituality
* Advise staff on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Participate in case conferences and provide information on offender progress

**Required Qualifications:**

* Recognized as an Elder or Cultural Advisor in their community
* Minimum of 5 years experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* Familiarity with and ability to conduct various ceremonies focused on healing
* Ability to provide guidance to staff and offenders on the protocols surrounding the use of traditional medicines and spiritual objects

**Contract Details**

* Contract Period: 18 months and 17 days, from September 14, 2022 to March 31, 2024
* Estimated Contract Value: $118,284.50 (GST/HST extra)
* Location: Kent Institution, British Columbia

**Solicitation Information**

* Solicitation Number: 21801-22-0062
* Solicitation Closing Date and Time: September 12, 2022, 2:00 PM PST

**Contact Information**

* Penny Anderson
* Procurement & Contracting Specialist
* CSC, 33991 Gladys Ave, Abbotsford, BC V2S 2E8
* Phone: 236-380-0298
* Email: [penny.anderson@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:penny.anderson@csc-scc.gc.ca)

This notice is being issued under the Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB), and is set-aside for Indigenous suppliers. Only suppliers who meet the definition of an Indigenous business, as defined in the PSIB, may submit a statement of capabilities for this opportunity.
